channel.title: Blogs on Sabrina Guerra
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Sabrina Guerra

item.title: Blog: Python
item.description: library(reticulate) hi<-"Hello" hi="world" print(r.hi,hi) ## Hello world cat(c(hi,py$hi)) ## Hello world Python and R are very both very useful and have similar languages but they each have their benefits. While the languages are distinct they can be used concurrently and be used to solve one problem. I find it interesting how python can organize large amounts of information and quantify it. An example of this would be the study of DNA nucleotides.
